title: 5,000 Evacuated After Train Derailment In Tennessee
teaser: The CSX train was carrying a toxic and flammable substance called acrylonitrile. The derailment and fire prompted a mandatory evacuation.
contentencoded:
A train derailment and fire prompted officials to call for a mandatory evacuation of 5,000 residents in the eastern Tennessee county of Blount. The CSX train was carrying a toxic and flammable substance called acrylonitrile.

Here & Now’s Robin Young speaks with Brandon Hollingsworth of WUOT in Knoxville, Tennessee, for the latest.

Guest

  • Brandon Hollingsworth, host, reporter and producer for WUOT in Knoxville, Tennessee.
